comments.commentBody:
"It was clear from the start that Mrs. Clinton was struggling to reassemble the Obama coalition"

What?! You really cannot have it both ways--nothing was "clear from the start" to anyone in he Clinton camp or the media. Don't abuse hindsight to make it seem like you're the best of a bad lot of prognosticators.
Why is "populism" associated with the people left behind?
Hillary was too close to Wall Street and people still remember that her husband, Bill Clinton, passed NAFTA free trade which destroyed the midwest
Blacks voted for the first black president. One off.
Another blame hillary article. She won the popular vote; the whitelash made sure the Trumpster won the electoral college,with Putin's help.
Clear form the start, to all, except the New York Times.

No mention of the 1.1 million votes of Americans of color (generally Democrats) purged from 30 GOP state voter rolls (including OH, MI & NC) via the "Interstate Voter Registration Crosscheck Program"?
(http://www.rollingstone.com/politics/features/the-gops-stealth-war-again...
Yeah, it crumbled so much Hillary only won by 3 million votes.
And how in light of all this information did the NYT claim Hilary had an 82% chance of winning on the day before the election?
It was never clear to the editorial and opinion staffs of the Times.  Seriously, clear?

The Obama coalition didn't crumbler, Cohn. It went to Bernie Sanders, the candidate you condemned to second place with your horrid columns at the beginning of his candidacy when you hid behind your numbers. Then at the end of the primaries, you apologized alright - for your Trump coverage. You and not a few other writers at The Times condemned Sanders at the beginning for not having a chance, when he would up being our only chance to keep Trump out of the White House. So please spare us about the crumbling of the Obama coalition when you tried to give it to Hillary from day one of your coverage.
To sum it up, you got it wrong Nate, way wrong.  Any other tidbits?
Life is good...and as they say in uneducated white america...have fun or don't

yeah sure, that is why Clinton lossed—she couldn't reassemble President Obama's coalition.

and the fact she had a 747 worth of baggage, a "We Can Lose This One Too, Yes We Can Campaign!" —oh by the way who in that Campaign decided NOT going to Wisconsin ONCE was a good idea—had nothing to do with it?

If we trusted the NYT was presenting reasoned, unbiased analysis, we agreed we don't need to nominate the popular guy, no one would vote for Trump, don't worry, no need to get out the vote for slam dunk Hillary.

That "analysis" did more for Trump than both Putin and Comey. Did the NYT and other media really wanted Trump?
Nope, poor, untrustworthy analysis helped him, not media conspiracy. But wait, he's great click bait and sells papers...
Leaving an opening is an understatement. Obama blew open the door and shoved Trump through. No Obama, no Trump.

Thanks for your post-election thoughts, Mr. 92% but why don't you try to figure out how and why you embarrassed yourself, embarrassed The Times, and in doing so, perhaps drove enough voters to Stein or to stay home because you said that she was a near-lock to turn the election into a tragedy.

White backlash.......No.1

Explain to me why 3 weeks before the election the chat was how the Republican Party was imploding.....and now that they won substitute the Democratic Party......
that is the most superficial analysis of what's going on......
Winning is nice.....but that doesn't mean that the Republican Party can in any
way be considered healthy.....positive. close to our supposed values...
total baloney.......look to the voters.....evaluate them
They bought into coal coming back, a viable steel industry...and dozens of never happening things.....
and btw, Hillary won by almost 3 million votes....Doesn't that throw a cog in your theory?
And while you guys are theorizing...trump is getting away with things day in and day out........NOW is important. try to keep up....

Hi Nate

You guys are over thinking this thing. The Democratic party pushed her nomination through, and basically made it impossible for any one to beat her.
Then she felt she was entitled. She did campaign well and some times did not campaign at all. She was over confident. Now it is the blame game every one else is at fault. No they are not Hillary Clinton, Harry Reid, and Debbie Wasserman Shultz are at fault not James Comey Putin, or for Heaven sakes Jill Stein.
If the Democrats want to win these races they need to invest at the state level,
and start being truly responsive to the middle class. You can tell people the economy is great and you guys are the losers. We can not help you. Bill Clinton and Barrack Obama had ideas Re-educaed encourage engagement in the new economy. Trust Me Trump lied we know it, and soon every one will.
He will be an awful president. really bad. But if all you have too offer is too bad so sorry no one will vote for you....
Actually believining in something and not apologizing for it will get you further than what Hillary and John Kerry did running for President. Stick to what you have said defend it even if people disagree with you they will respect you.

Got get younger Invest in the states. Howard Dean knew it and we got a few good candidates including Obama. Yes they are head strong but that is exactly what we need...... Not Tim Kane a good man but a boring one....

why has no article in the NYT mentioned that nationwide and in the states that decided 2016, WI/PA/MI, voters who chose "terrorism" as their top issue went to Trump in landslides?

Really, this election WAS as simple as Hillary using the term "Islamic terrorism" and not being for admitting 50000 Muslim refugees from Syria. None of the other stuff would've mattered; she'd be POTUS-elect.
Long story short:  HC was the wrong candidate.  Just look at the messages of Bernie Sanders and Trump.  Voters moved from Hope to simply, Change.  With little hope.

Another after-the-fact piece by Nate Cohn, using all his quant-driven analysis to explain something - that he couldn't explain BEFORE the election! Why not? Because underneath all that complex techie-type talk, all he really does is compile other people's polls and work out some algorithm that he thinks makes sense, and if you can't understand it - if you can't wade through all the tech talk - well, that's on you.

Well, garbage in, garbage out. Cohn was as wrong as those pollsters, and as wrong as all the media and Clinton campaign honchos who didn't listen to people who were warning that she was in deep trouble.

Yet he still has a job at the Times. Why?

Wake up, Democrats! Seems like I heard about these economic issues with the lower and middle classes, and with white non-affluent voters, before. Like, a year and a half ago. Somebody was talking about how they would determine the election. Oh yeah, it was Bernie Sanders. Too bad you didn't listen to him then (and for the last 30 years).

Get with the reality of what's happened under poor Democratic leadership, and move forward. The country needs your leadership!

Why did Hillary Clinton lose?
~Misogyny
~3d terms for a political party are very rare. We swap parties every 8 years, pretty much.
~Dynasty. No more Bushes and no more Clintons. I voted for Bernie in the primary.
~Inevitability. Americans don't like coronations.
~Comey. Reminded some people that they think she's a crook. I saw it as a thumb on the scale.
~Much kerfuffle about nothing re: Clinton Foundation, wikileaks, etc. But people bought it and asked for more.
~Boring. Hillary Clinton is a dull, boring speaker and political persona. Sizzle, no matter how offensive and outrageous, will trump boring every time (see what I did there?)
~Wonk. Hillary Clinton is a wonk. People want a perceived leader, not a wonk. I voted for her, anyway.
~Comey, 10 days later. Reminded people that she always gets away with being a crook (in the view of some.)
~Fainting. Need us a strong man! :rolleyes:
~Did I mention misogyny?
~The political moment was all about change. Hillary is status quo.
~Hipper-than-thou staff, aides, Brooklyn campaign hq. They sort of knew everything until they didn't.
~Well-past sell-by date. Hillary Clinton has been on the political scene for nearly 40 years.

Note to Democrats: we must do better.

These are paraphrased from NYT articles today :
#1 "Is Obama Bad for Democrats ?"
#2 "Is Hillary struggling to reassemble the Obama coalition ?"
#3 "Is Trump’s views on immigration appealing ?"

If only NYT and the democrats had asked these questions.
Many of us did, but we were derided as racists for asking #1, misogynists for asking #2, and xenophobics for asking #3.
If only ...
